approximately one third died due to delayed or interrupted medical care.

They reportedly visited
3,000 residences and found thirty-eight people living in households that had died between September 20th when Maria hit and the end of 2017. And they spread
the residences between 104 Barrios to ensure even representation between urban and rural areas. That total was then converted into a mortality rate
which was 14.3 deaths per thousand residents and then was used to estimate the total for the entire island.
That estimate was then compared to statistics from 2016 which showed a 62 percent increase in the mortality rate after Maria.
